WRITING.TEXT: It would be nice if they'd add one, or at least a Net Neutrality filter, and actually enforce flairs on posts about it (currently there are several posts about the FCC/Net Neutrality that are unflaired).
Doesn't a custard have to have eggs in it? That's why Quiche is considered a custard.
Why does everything have to be rebooted? I guess I'll add this below Incredible Spider-Man and Fantastic Four on the the list of incredibly useless and stupid cash grab reboots I'll never watch.

WRITING.TEXT: Peppridge Farm remembers.
If he starts barking the lyrics to In A Gadda Da Vida, then he really will be.

WRITING.TITLE: TIL: Buster Keaton's last role was 1966's A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum. True to form, the 70 year old actor did (most of) his own stunts

WRITING.TEXT: That's Rule Britannia, not God Save the Queen :)

I get the intent of things like Omaze, and can appreciate that they really do raise some money for charity (80% goes to charity, 20% to Omaze), but this also seems like a pretty crummy form of slacktivism. This is essentially people buying lottery tickets for a very small chance of hanging out with a celebrity and being able to feel good about the fact that they have almost no chance of winning.
We forgive you, now where is our damn apology for Celine Dion and Justin Bieber, buddy?

I've got to ask, a [graveyard in Massachusetts](https://www.google.com/maps/place/42%C2%B035'11.6%22N+72%C2%B001'15.2%22W/@42.5865556,-72.0230776,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x0!8m2!3d42.586567!4d-72.020893) or [Northern Antarctica](https://www.google.com/maps/place/7201'15.2"S+4235'11.6"E/@-74.0989855,15.607182,3z)?
The problem with using decimal notation and a non-standard graphical orientation, is that there is no clues as to which is latitude and which is longitude, other than making certain assumptions based on the results.

Mods already have tools to deal with this on a subreddit by subreddit, post by post, and comment by comment basis. Why would the admins get involved in this when this is already something subs can deal with if they wish?

I'm not sure I'd use it, but I think it's a good idea to at least have.
I'd suggest posting this over in /r/beta, either as a comment in the megathread or as a separate post, since it may get more visibility there.

For users that have 5 trophies, there shouldn't be a view all/view less option, since the page already shows the first 5 trophies automatically, and the button doesn't do anything except toggle between showing view all/view less.
Feel free to test on my userpage, since I have exactly 5 trophies don't expect to get more anytime soon.

Not sure if you're watching replies to your comments, but I'd like to add my name to the list suggesting that as an immediate (to the extent any changes to this are immediate) fix, since it severely degrades the usability and usefulness of profile pages to have profile posts and subreddit posts lumped together.
I take the stance that as long as you're PMing yourself in private, and not disturbing the neighbors, it's nobody else's concern but your own.

WRITING.TITLE: Add a posted to userpage tab on new beta userpages
WRITING.TEXT: It would be really nice and useful to have an easy way, or really any way, to separate the content that a posted to their userpage from their posts to other subreddits. Currently there is no way to separate the two so if you are interested in finding (or re-finding) one, you have to go through and look through all the posts they've made.

WRITING.TITLE: Formatting PGP keys on Reddit
WRITING.TEXT:
**Note**: This has been sitting on my private test sub for awhile, and I didn't think to post it on my now gone public sub while I had it. Now that I changed over to the new userpage design, I might as well inaugurate it with this post. This is originally copied from [a long dead subreddit (/r/silkroad)](https://www.reddit.com/r/SilkRoad/comments/1seuvn/formatting_pgp_keys_on_reddit/), all credit goes to [a long gone user](/u/badwolfhosting). Hopefully this will still be useful to someone or other.
**2nd note:** To preserve original formatting I am not adding in quotation formatting (\ symbols at the beginning of each line). Everything below this comment is copied verbatim from the original post, I don't warrant that it still works (please comment and let me know if it doesn't) and any grammar or syntax issues are the original author's not mine.
---- nbsp; nbsp; nbsp;
We see then many, many people are including their PGP key but not formatting it correctly. Not only does this mean that your messages may not be able to be validated, but your keys are impossible for most to import without heavy editing. So, how do you make this:
_______
^^-----BEGIN ^^PGP ^^PUBLIC ^^KEY ^^BLOCK-----
^^mQENBFKHq4kBCADdOnrTI3l0jizftwUSiYQuI3tvVDyHNzlt1HOokWNl4Neqq67J ^^qJn+T8JiKP5eTocN1X6ladIJC9aodzPJcHYfm/CKBblE+qK6xVDSvigb/xqi4O9x ^^cZfn3pHMc4j/NXW6hRqfbxinCU/Qu9ByBGb7sm6rZJBlMvGYm7NxadYDYDr596c1 ^^RwQMwJ/gLzF2lo3MJ0jyi4bzulfA2PT+TKawkvVG2en5EaVgT1aDI55TeBLWvv5c ^^oZwJrHb//5960ApePKmHH+YRob9WcPOglmr50elnNAoJDZit1l8+uiUaek61RTo/ ^^4MQ98rMokGmZnmZLbyK8rJj/kYthChbEdq5nABEBAAG0J1RocmVlSGFyZXNCYXph ^^YXIgPDNIYXJlc0BzYWZlLW1haWwubmV0PokBOQQTAQIAIwUCUoeriQIbAwcLCQgH ^^AwIBBhUIAgkKCwQWAgMBAh4BAheAAAoJEEUUW3UvMqmk5BQH/3XSsgUoQFBMpRgz ^^KUIooZX8z7GjspcOR3kamI6q61BJI27r36sXPgok5C3bYCRTeDjL5pjf0qVLR4OG ^^1xNJpsEeZmYxjj75963t+FjKkL0lmaM0LRXUFyhxqJJF7af7jTZSnF0iZZs1Ql9D ^^nzWA4+BbSu/Oa+qEMQZLNbKftoE2jRLHArgirUGEiHUw5FXWzG7e+k+Ckra2Cjgv ^^8ImXPNFbJRteIIGHs2BSx0IXhCoNuX6ga/vMhfIr+1nbRPtu0/YR6uhYGdatJNIr ^^wQXWzgJjkAIGDK3Dmi+qSCGoqsuKK7oQkfIYCxfvYNzVo9j351XLyY08KlbxcU+0 ^^L7l1aHy5AQ0EUoeriQEIAMjvpNPWyUphO23eHfj69x7iOz95hQKQStcURm4MDBn7 ^^gfjei5sTF1HLwxY+KYVnv2roF9SI96sThsnKrOFBzUrnd5vVziPmWLfwZQ1Z+dBR ^^z/30GXXxOFjSKqV2MFNdLy6q6xYfOFp2wZxw67n1LYUP3d/bRKTM6N60Po9CYKkM ^^bhs7FXE1fFf8VRuFT5cdoINUTmasAmZ71pedTBS6rPpcRJREQO/SoYLgPbm7VYoh ^^eO41OPrkVAvrrbKCTYV7AC2LYExNommWlWksJTFw35iTEO41IVJt6K3qgi3oSxZ+ ^^OHdP11sXI6A26j6YYlM6p0dQESnBTqxO/u/GONkDeQ0AEQEAAYkBHwQYAQIACQUC ^^UoeriQIbDAAKCRBFFFt1LzKppBSxB/4kGkC6ZecE1lGE5ovT2QieadbtqSoEjFaV ^^KPlrckOI0qdxpncfEDuMLc7E5Tf/ZwoEbvDFJZEl6t1LX1GwW9jpOv3LSep3VDad ^^+E9bamiM77Yq+OOXFKkq2CY5nkqBdLYyFWHOTEK+zu1qzVDFX7/yG3EpT5/7X+D5 ^^GgxZaGjaoHryRQ7BAmoBXwy16dOBXk+JYDcwEPmpP3S2jHHQIMop60Jrx03BPVtC ^^oVHApoTVZImt+uvHpgoti88Z6ZqUQ3B7PrEqaVnd9Xap4rWIMjZc5zZsXo8fKTvL ^^oWk6y0hbTUmNeodY/yy2aTsXKYDEn5DPyqi36iJRtRk7wlrgM/mL ^^=FV7L ^^-----END ^^PGP ^^PUBLIC ^^KEY ^^BLOCK-----
_______
Into This:
_______
^^-----BEGIN ^^PGP ^^PUBLIC ^^KEY ^^BLOCK-----
^^mQENBFKHq4kBCADdOnrTI3l0jizftwUSiYQuI3tvVDyHNzlt1HOokWNl4Neqq67J ^^qJn+T8JiKP5eTocN1X6ladIJC9aodzPJcHYfm/CKBblE+qK6xVDSvigb/xqi4O9x ^^cZfn3pHMc4j/NXW6hRqfbxinCU/Qu9ByBGb7sm6rZJBlMvGYm7NxadYDYDr596c1 ^^RwQMwJ/gLzF2lo3MJ0jyi4bzulfA2PT+TKawkvVG2en5EaVgT1aDI55TeBLWvv5c ^^oZwJrHb//5960ApePKmHH+YRob9WcPOglmr50elnNAoJDZit1l8+uiUaek61RTo/ ^^4MQ98rMokGmZnmZLbyK8rJj/kYthChbEdq5nABEBAAG0J1RocmVlSGFyZXNCYXph ^^YXIgPDNIYXJlc0BzYWZlLW1haWwubmV0PokBOQQTAQIAIwUCUoeriQIbAwcLCQgH ^^AwIBBhUIAgkKCwQWAgMBAh4BAheAAAoJEEUUW3UvMqmk5BQH/3XSsgUoQFBMpRgz ^^KUIooZX8z7GjspcOR3kamI6q61BJI27r36sXPgok5C3bYCRTeDjL5pjf0qVLR4OG ^^1xNJpsEeZmYxjj75963t+FjKkL0lmaM0LRXUFyhxqJJF7af7jTZSnF0iZZs1Ql9D ^^nzWA4+BbSu/Oa+qEMQZLNbKftoE2jRLHArgirUGEiHUw5FXWzG7e+k+Ckra2Cjgv ^^8ImXPNFbJRteIIGHs2BSx0IXhCoNuX6ga/vMhfIr+1nbRPtu0/YR6uhYGdatJNIr ^^wQXWzgJjkAIGDK3Dmi+qSCGoqsuKK7oQkfIYCxfvYNzVo9j351XLyY08KlbxcU+0 ^^L7l1aHy5AQ0EUoeriQEIAMjvpNPWyUphO23eHfj69x7iOz95hQKQStcURm4MDBn7 ^^gfjei5sTF1HLwxY+KYVnv2roF9SI96sThsnKrOFBzUrnd5vVziPmWLfwZQ1Z+dBR ^^z/30GXXxOFjSKqV2MFNdLy6q6xYfOFp2wZxw67n1LYUP3d/bRKTM6N60Po9CYKkM ^^bhs7FXE1fFf8VRuFT5cdoINUTmasAmZ71pedTBS6rPpcRJREQO/SoYLgPbm7VYoh ^^eO41OPrkVAvrrbKCTYV7AC2LYExNommWlWksJTFw35iTEO41IVJt6K3qgi3oSxZ+ ^^OHdP11sXI6A26j6YYlM6p0dQESnBTqxO/u/GONkDeQ0AEQEAAYkBHwQYAQIACQUC ^^UoeriQIbDAAKCRBFFFt1LzKppBSxB/4kGkC6ZecE1lGE5ovT2QieadbtqSoEjFaV ^^KPlrckOI0qdxpncfEDuMLc7E5Tf/ZwoEbvDFJZEl6t1LX1GwW9jpOv3LSep3VDad ^^+E9bamiM77Yq+OOXFKkq2CY5nkqBdLYyFWHOTEK+zu1qzVDFX7/yG3EpT5/7X+D5 ^^GgxZaGjaoHryRQ7BAmoBXwy16dOBXk+JYDcwEPmpP3S2jHHQIMop60Jrx03BPVtC ^^oVHApoTVZImt+uvHpgoti88Z6ZqUQ3B7PrEqaVnd9Xap4rWIMjZc5zZsXo8fKTvL ^^oWk6y0hbTUmNeodY/yy2aTsXKYDEn5DPyqi36iJRtRk7wlrgM/mL ^^=FV7L ^^-----END ^^PGP ^^PUBLIC ^^KEY ^^BLOCK-----
_______
It's quite simply really. at the end of each new line just put 4 spaces. No need to hit enter because the lines are already correct, you just need to tell reddit to separate each one. If you do not add 4 spaces then reddit appends the end of the line to the beginning of the next, no returns or spaces.
If you prefer for it to display with code and linenums then just add 4 spaces to the beginning instead of the end.
And if you want your big PGP key to be smaller, format it like so:
^^-----BEGIN ^^PGP ^^PUBLIC ^^KEY ^^BLOCK-----
^^mQENBFKHq4kBCADdOnrTI3l0jizftwUSiYQuI3tvVDyHNzlt1HOokWNl4Neqq67J ^^qJn+T8JiKP5eTocN1X6ladIJC9aodzPJcHYfm/CKBblE+qK6xVDSvigb/xqi4O9x ^^cZfn3pHMc4j/NXW6hRqfbxinCU/Qu9ByBGb7sm6rZJBlMvGYm7NxadYDYDr596c1 ^^RwQMwJ/gLzF2lo3MJ0jyi4bzulfA2PT+TKawkvVG2en5EaVgT1aDI55TeBLWvv5c ^^oZwJrHb//5960ApePKmHH+YRob9WcPOglmr50elnNAoJDZit1l8+uiUaek61RTo/ ^^4MQ98rMokGmZnmZLbyK8rJj/kYthChbEdq5nABEBAAG0J1RocmVlSGFyZXNCYXph ^^YXIgPDNIYXJlc0BzYWZlLW1haWwubmV0PokBOQQTAQIAIwUCUoeriQIbAwcLCQgH ^^AwIBBhUIAgkKCwQWAgMBAh4BAheAAAoJEEUUW3UvMqmk5BQH/3XSsgUoQFBMpRgz ^^KUIooZX8z7GjspcOR3kamI6q61BJI27r36sXPgok5C3bYCRTeDjL5pjf0qVLR4OG ^^1xNJpsEeZmYxjj75963t+FjKkL0lmaM0LRXUFyhxqJJF7af7jTZSnF0iZZs1Ql9D ^^nzWA4+BbSu/Oa+qEMQZLNbKftoE2jRLHArgirUGEiHUw5FXWzG7e+k+Ckra2Cjgv ^^8ImXPNFbJRteIIGHs2BSx0IXhCoNuX6ga/vMhfIr+1nbRPtu0/YR6uhYGdatJNIr ^^wQXWzgJjkAIGDK3Dmi+qSCGoqsuKK7oQkfIYCxfvYNzVo9j351XLyY08KlbxcU+0 ^^L7l1aHy5AQ0EUoeriQEIAMjvpNPWyUphO23eHfj69x7iOz95hQKQStcURm4MDBn7 ^^gfjei5sTF1HLwxY+KYVnv2roF9SI96sThsnKrOFBzUrnd5vVziPmWLfwZQ1Z+dBR ^^z/30GXXxOFjSKqV2MFNdLy6q6xYfOFp2wZxw67n1LYUP3d/bRKTM6N60Po9CYKkM ^^bhs7FXE1fFf8VRuFT5cdoINUTmasAmZ71pedTBS6rPpcRJREQO/SoYLgPbm7VYoh ^^eO41OPrkVAvrrbKCTYV7AC2LYExNommWlWksJTFw35iTEO41IVJt6K3qgi3oSxZ+ ^^OHdP11sXI6A26j6YYlM6p0dQESnBTqxO/u/GONkDeQ0AEQEAAYkBHwQYAQIACQUC ^^UoeriQIbDAAKCRBFFFt1LzKppBSxB/4kGkC6ZecE1lGE5ovT2QieadbtqSoEjFaV ^^KPlrckOI0qdxpncfEDuMLc7E5Tf/ZwoEbvDFJZEl6t1LX1GwW9jpOv3LSep3VDad ^^+E9bamiM77Yq+OOXFKkq2CY5nkqBdLYyFWHOTEK+zu1qzVDFX7/yG3EpT5/7X+D5 ^^GgxZaGjaoHryRQ7BAmoBXwy16dOBXk+JYDcwEPmpP3S2jHHQIMop60Jrx03BPVtC ^^oVHApoTVZImt+uvHpgoti88Z6ZqUQ3B7PrEqaVnd9Xap4rWIMjZc5zZsXo8fKTvL ^^oWk6y0hbTUmNeodY/yy2aTsXKYDEn5DPyqi36iJRtRk7wlrgM/mL ^^=FV7L ^^-----END ^^PGP ^^PUBLIC ^^KEY ^^BLOCK-----
OBJECTION!

For the most part I might agree with you, except some beer really is mass produced swill, Bud/Bud Light and Coors/Coors Light being the two that come to mind. You're right that that these companies can make good beer, and not just because of acquisitions, but they have a market selling beer to people who don't know or just don't care about quality, either in general or situationally (such as just wanting something cheap and marginally alcoholic while watching NASCAR. It may make business sense for them to market to those crowds, but calling them out on it is hardly snobbery, and if it is, it is IMO well justified.
That's all you can say, that's all you can say!

I think you're oversimplifying a bit. Large chunks of property are not going to suddenly become less expensive to purchase or rent if we made it harder or outright banned them from buying property here. It's a somewhat perverse thing, but while foreign investment almost certainly helped inflate the bubble, it's probably not going to be deflated by backing that off, at least not in the short term.

And your point being? The fact that we (Americans and Europeans) made poor choices does not belittle the fact that now they have legitimately (and admittedly in some cases not entirely legitimately) earned money to spend on real estate. Being pouty about it doesn't do any good, nor does pretending like these Chinese buyers don't exist and it is, to an extent, in our best interest to bring their money into the US, even in exchange for hard assets like real estate.
Previous owner then maybe, who knows.

I'll keep those in mind next time I need to keep more space dry (which happens from time to time depending on my acquisitions). Refreshing in an oven is IMO not a big deal compared to the expense of paying for new packs every time they get full, although I'd be interested if anyone ever did a cost/benefit analysis between the two options.
Smells faintly of pipe tobacco.

Out of curiosity, besides the presumable premium bump for being ~40 years old, is it worth more because it's from a non N-American or European country and thus presumably a bit harder to find on the broad market?

Thank you very much for including that pouch with it, it's the perfect size and really adds to making it special. If you ever want to visit it, let me know. I'm sure it can be arranged next time I need to send something your way. We transact back and forth enough that it wouldn't be a problem :)

Bought this from /u/zuizide, who [posted about it](https://www.reddit.com/r/Silverbugs/comments/6akxst/stunning_the_toning_on_this_vintage_chunky/) 5 days ago before I knew I had to have it and immediately bought it off him.

WRITING.TITLE: Mail Call - The Return of the Chunky Academy Pour

WRITING.TEXT:
Maybe try some of those silica gel packets?
I've had a decent amount of success with reusable dehumidifying systems. [This is the one](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000H0XFCS) I'm using now, although it's too soon to tell how it'll hold up in the long run (I've had it 4 months and so far so good though).

I'll skip the empty platitudes to go right ahead to saying that this really upsets me and makes me angry. Not only does this of course hurt you, but it is an attack on the whole community, both internally for what you and others may think of transacting business with fellow silverbugs here, and externally for anyone who may be considering joining our community, whether they decide to buy or sell on pmsforsale/silverbugs or not.
On a personal note, this is why I only tend to buy from people who have a solid history of posting here, and not just a history on pmsforsale. Not only may someone be buying and selling elsewhere with people, including private deals with silverbugs here that don't go through pmsforsale, that won't get counted in their feedback number there, but a long history in the community here is IMO a better metric and harder/more work for a scammer to fake than a few small trades over there to boost their feedback number.

And now that other sellers they can't charge as much. It's still pretty shitty to nakedly gouge your customers for over twice fair price (in this case the price relative to the **5** previous rounds in the series) when they were the only seller, and they IMO should not be rewarded for it with further business. That's the reason I'll keep calling them out whenever they're mentioned. If I thought it would make a difference, and more to the point, that I had the willpower to actually follow through with it, I would be boycotting and campaigning against Elemetal (the makers of the Privateer series) too, since they are complicit in choosing to wholesale to a seller that engages in bad behavior. I'm not going to kid myself though, I'll buy their rounds nearly every time.

Look, was it stupid, especially if there's a fire extinguisher handy or a suppression system? Yeah. That being said, if you or I panicked, we might go for the gallon of flour too. I'd damn well take it like a man when I was told to clean up the mess by myself though.
What the fuck?
Wouldn't that just cause another explosion? Ice + boiling oil is going to essentially burst, expelling a lot of energy and splashing oil everywhere.

And if you can't get out then hit the deck. You might still get sprayed a little bit but it will be falling droplets that have cooled a bit more than a direct blast of oil out of the fryer would have.
1 creme brle'd chef, coming up.

You contradicted yourself there, if the business has a vested interest in not having to hire new workers to replace pregnant ones then regulating them to force them to behave in a certain way is unnecessary and redundant. People are not going to stop having kids because the government doesn't legislate benefits for pregnant women, most of human history backs that up, leaving your only real valid argument being the societal good when little Billy Jr gets born anyway because his parents either purposefully or accidentally had unprotected sex. That leaves our point of contention, as I see it, as to whether everyone else (because you're kidding yourself if you don't think business costs don't get passed on to consumers and the other burdens from light duty workers don't get passed on to co-workers) should have to pay for the "right" to procreate.

I think a lot of people would be in favor of at least considering the idea of charging people who engage in inherently risky activities more when they require care for their behavior. The problem with that though, is that such discussions have always devolved into charging fat people more and diabetics more for bad diets, it's tough to figure out a line on risky behavior, not to mention create a policy around it.
Maybe Code Black isn't the one I was thinking of then, it is tough to remember all the medical series.

If they're not using precautions then why should we, individually or as a society, treat it any different than if they were doing it on purpose?
There are legitimate arguments to be made regarding the fact that a lot of people don't get even basic sex ed and the lack of contraceptive availability, but at the end of the day, personal responsibility is personal responsibility and have have pretty close to zero sympathy for anyone who isn't using protection and not trying to get pregnant but gets pregnant anyway after voluntarily and willingly having sex.

The difference is people aren't trying to break their legs. Also, IMO when it comes to accidents, there is a distinction between doing something that may break your legs, and doing something that has a decently high chance (if done without protection and birth control) of getting someone pregnant. Admittedly that's a generalization, since women still get pregnant sometimes when taking precautions (although the rate is well under 1% if I remember correctly if using both birth control and condoms), but it still holds.

As for you last question, you are required to follow any ATC command when within controlled airspace, whether VFR or IFR (91.123)
I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the one, and to my knowledge only one, superseding rule, 91.3(b), which states: In an in-flight emergency requiring immediate action, the pilot in command may deviate from any rule of this part to the extent required to meet that emergency.
That isn't an excuse to ignore ATC; however, it does preclude the responsibility to follow their instructions in case of a declared (or even I guess a non-declared) emergency, although if you don't let them know what's going on that'll make it worse off for everyone.

I could give you the whole spiel about my stance on how it is unfair, but the cost gets put onto us and there are better ways to fix the system and more fairly apportion the cost, including to the father, but I feel like I'd be wasting my keystrokes. I disagree with this from both a policy and pragmatic matter though, mainly because Wal-Mart and the other corporations just pass the cost along, so it's still very problematic.

Only when it comes to stopping someone from buying the latest Eminem CD, otherwise they're pro Walton Family, and not much else.
The above comments are by no means a defense of Wal-Mart, nor should anyone be naive enough to think that they're the only company that is, has, or will be forced to comply with and eventually caught violating laws in regards to treatment of pregnant workers.

I'm not blaming them for not wanting them to endanger their pregnancies. I just take issue with the term "legitimate medical condition," in the context of something that the employer should be obligated to give special consideration for, when it is something that is (in most cases) voluntarily, if not entirely purposefully, self created.

Anyone who is thinking about giving BGASC their money, I would recommend reading up on the shady crap they pulled with the P6 rounds, jacking up the prices to ridiculous levels (over 2x the price of the previous rounds in the series).

Remind's me of Prince of Persia which used the same type of copy protection, although if I remember correctly, they just included a series of codes outright, and you had to use a specific one of the codes when prompted.
How many other "legitimate medical conditions" are entirely voluntary (except for rape) or otherwise entirely voluntarily avoidable with proper foresight to an accuracy of ~99%?
Only one is entirely voluntary, except in cases of rape, though.
That dog is so cute. Not the bratty little puppy chewing on the ear,the big one.

I'm not sure he'd ever do it, or if he'll ever act again for that matter. Other than documentaries about his role as Sisko, he's been in 4 projects (one of which was a Star Trek video game) since DS9 ended. He's like a beatnik type guy now. I don't get it, but if it makes him happy then more power to him.
What is a gay hit? It's Raining Men? -Will Truman
What season 9? I'm in deep denial and maintain to this day that Scrubs ended with the amazing hallway scene at the end of the season 8 finale with the cuts to the final scenes with the main actors.

This has to be the stupidest thing I've ever seen, and yet I can't look away and can't wait for it to air. If nothing else Dylan McDermott is going to ensure that this will be pretty funny for as long as it lasts.

Didn't they already try some shit like this on a better network? I remember Code Black (which pretty much tanked, despite decent actors), and another one with a Doctor with a gay ex husband and multiple lovers, which tanked in under a season. Give this premise a fucking rest.
I realize his response to this would be "fuck you," but are we honestly expecting him to live another 5-10 years?
What the fuck?
Too bad Avery Brooks is ~~absolutely nuts~~ delightfully eccentric, otherwise he could be called upon to guest star.

Look how long the premise for that lasted though? They immediately dumped in more characters to make up for the fact that Will Forte, while funny gets very tiring very fast if left alone and Kristen Schaal is a one note actress,she plays batshit crazy very well, but that is pretty much all she ever plays (see 30 Rock).

Good riddance to that though. How long can you string along jokes about Mexican immigrants, both legal and especially jokes about illegal immigration, and racist Southerners? The entire premise of the show should have preempted it ever being picked up.
I commend my soul to any god that can find it.
The same type idiocy behind this is why Bacardi stopped making 151. Too many idiots were doing stupid things with it.

Since I guess I'm the first commenter here this morning I'll take the opportunity to plug two great podcast episodes I listened to recently. They were the *Planet Money* podcast episodes "When India's Cash Disappeared" Part 1 and Part 2 (Episode 770 and 771). IMO they're a bit lighter than they could be on substance, in the name of giving compelling stories from people involved in and affected by the demonetization, but they're still a pretty good listen.

I would just agree to disagree with you on most of it but I have two major issues with your statement.
1) It's not late, it's just incredibly early. Where I am it's about 0330. If you disagree, then I'll be happy to invite you to some eccentric person's house with a bunch of strangers and we can see who survives the night :)
2) While I will agree that Clue may very well never have happened if Murder by Death hadn't happened, I tend to think that your statement that parodies build on the parodies before them is at best overly simplistic. I'm not going to ask you to source your statements, since, as you said, it is incredibly late, or at least very early, but I would say that there's a lot more to it than that, especially since parody had to start somewhere so some parodies are not building on previous works other than what they're directly parodying.
As I kind of laid out more in another comment here, they are two very different movies other than the fact that they are both subversions of and homages to the murder mystery genre.

I would argue that other than being subversions of and homages to the murder mystery genre that they couldn't be more different. Clue is a spoof, it makes fun of the whole genre. Murder by Death on the other hand spoofs the genre, but is more specifically a parody of a specific set of works, and less specifically a few well known murder mystery authors through their most famous characters.

Yeah, I don't remember the full list of exceptions but it's a pretty short list. If the infraction wasn't intentional or malicious and the pilot shows a good faith effort to accept what they did and learn from it so they don't do it again, the FAA now has no interest in punishing people for these issues. That being said, they were perfectly honest about the fact that they know they have serious trust issues with pilots, especially people who have been pilots for a long time, because of their previous stance towards punishment, and that it will take a good amount of time to build up trust.

One way to tell a good college from a scummy college is to see if they have a policy that forbids professors from assigning their books outright (most ideal), at least requires a committee to approve of it beforehand (less ideal, but still ok if they don't try to quid pro quo each other), or at least requires department chair approval (least ideal of the three, and most prone to abuse/corruption, but still slightly better than nothing).
They are through either choice or bad circumstances gullible and arguably poorly educated, at least in how the real world works.

Why should they get coverage and why should viewers be interested in them? They are one of many countries with oppressive dictatorial rulers, they are one of dozens of countries where the populace is starving, they have little economic impact right now and their collapse is not going to a adversely affect the day to day lives of citizens of any country outside of theirs, except conceivably their neighbors such as Brazil. It may be incredibly selfish, but we have our own problems, and there is no reason to care about theirs.

The local FSDO folks came up to Palo Alto a few days ago and did a seminar on "Compliance Philosphy" (the actual name of the seminar), that they are really serious about doing away with enforcement actions unless they really have to.
They also stated that the clock for how often you can use immunity (I believe you can only invoke it once every 4 years) if applicable/usable (i.e. you do something that doesn't fall under one of the exceptions to immunity), only starts if they actually do something that is considered an enforcement action. They have pretty much, but not entirely gotten rid of the letters of warning and are trying to be a much more education focused (but they stressed, not necessarily a "kinder and gentler" government agency).
In short, from what I took away and can surmise, is that anything that is educational, like the FSDO re-educating, talking to a pilot on the phone or in person about what they did wrong, or a requirement that the pilot go to an instructor and get retrained on a given area, is now not considered an enforcement action for the purposes of starting the clock as it is not sent to Oklahoma City or put on the pilot's file. It is kept on with the FSDO, but that seems to be it (whether it counts as enforcement that can be waived/avoided through an ASRS report, I don't know).

Did you ever hear the tragedy of Darth NZ Mint The Wise? I thought not. Its not a story the Jedi would tell you. Its a Sith legend. Darth NZ Mint was a Mint from a land down under, so powerful and so wise they could use famous IP to influence the public to buy anything they might want to sell They had such a knowledge of the dark side of minting that they could even keep shit coin series they didn't care about from dying. The dark side of minting is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. They became so powerful the only thing they were afraid of was losing this power, which eventually, of course, they did. Fortunately, even apprentices know everything they knew, when other mints kill them in their sleep for hawking shitty products with iconic imagery, it will be it will be ironic. They could save others from death, but not themselves.

In the early days of bitcoin I was wrong, very very wrong about it dropping back down (a mistake that in retrospect cost me at least several hundred thousand dollars in potentially realized gains). That being said, every time it has gone past $1200 it has settled back down and there is no reason to think that this is anything different. There is absolutely nothing to support the higher price point right now, no news, no new innovation or usage, so this is a pretty clear bubble.

WRITING.TEXT: At the rate btc is bubbling, many will pay the high price to buy quickly then just as quickly lose far more than that. If anyone tells you this current price spike isn't an unsupported bubble, ask yourself how they're profiting from your ignorance, because they are lying to you.
